description.narrative: Boko Haram conflict in the North East Nigeria has been raging for a while now butÂ due to the recent deteriorationÂ and regional spill-over, the situation has become a truly regional and mutli-sectoral complex emergency (acute food insecurity/famine, health disaster with multiple epidemic outbreak, population movements etc). An increase in media coverage and public interest in the crisis has been noted. On 31st October, BRC launched its Lake Chad crisis emergency appeal to support ICRC's relief activities in the region - mainly Nigeria and Cameroon. In 2016, BRC supported the ICRC through the secondment of 3 delegates in the North East of Nigeria (logistics and 2 CTP), 1 CTP delegate in Cameroon and provided a total of funded Â£557K to the ICRC regional Lake Chad appeals: - 150K to the Nigeria appeal (fully funded) - 407K to the Cameroon appeal: 207 from the disaster fund, 100K from the income of the BRC appeal and 100K of underspent G funds.
